  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Defense Secretary Robert Gates announced today that
  General Peter Pace is being replaced as chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff.
  Secretary Gates said the move would avoid re-nomination hearings that
  promised to be “contentious” and “divisive” for the
  military. David Martin will tell you about the surprising announcement and give
  you details about the new nominee for the senior-ranking officer in the U.S.
  military. And I’ll chat with Sharyl Attkisson about the influence
  lawmakers on Capitol Hill have had on the decision.
 
From Iraq,
  we’ll bring you a story no one else in the Western media has been able
  to cover. But our Lara Logan did – she interviewed Sunni insurgents who
  are now fighting al Qaeda alongside U.S. forces. We’ll show you
  her story tonight.
 
President Bush said auf
  wiedersehen today to the members of the G-8 today before stopping
  in Poland and heading on
  to Rome. There,
  the president is scheduled to meet with officials as well as with Pope Benedict
  XVI, but the timing of his visit could not be worse, as Richard Roth will
  report.
 
Finally, for this week’s Assignment America,
  Steve Hartman will take you to a ranch that’s given some very special young
  people the summer vacation of a lifetime.
 
Thanks and I hope you have a great weekend!
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
